name: deliberatively
content:

in a way that involves careful thought and discussion when making decisions: Decisions made quickly can be just as good as decisions made cautiously and deliberatively. That question is a good one to consider again, and this time more deliberatively.
More examplesFewer examplesThe wise thing to do would be to move cautiously and deliberatively through the process.Trustees now exercise their power more deliberatively, more slowly than before.The programme was deliberatively designed to be responsive to the evidence.
